Name: Stela of Amenemhat
Description: The stela has a curved top with a conical addition, imitating a pyramidion. The decorated section is divided into two registers. The upper register shows a seated Osiris on the left, faced by a man adoring the god and offering. The second register has three columns of text on the left, on the right are a standing woman and two men.The shape of the stela is typical of the Ramesside Period.
